intro: Chiliadenus hesperius, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, exhibiting drought tolerance and succulent leaves to store water. Its flowering period typically occurs in the spring and early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chiliadenus hesperius plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing nectar and habitat for various wildlife species.
